TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PolicyResource extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a policy resource that is available to the policy feature.

remarks.para: A policy feature can use one or more policy resources. A policy resource is an assembly that assists the policy feature by providing some functionality that the feature needs. For example, the Expiration policy feature employs an Expiration Formula Calculator as a policy resource to determine a document's actual expiration date. This policy feature also uses an Expiration Action policy resource to determine what action to take when an item reaches its expiration date.
Policy features can use multiple resources, but each policy resource can be used by only one policy feature.
For more information, see Policy Resource Overview.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AssemblyName As String
public: property System::String ^ AssemblyName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the strong name of the policy resource assembly.
Docs.value: A string that represents the strong name of the policy resource assembly.

remarks.para: The policy resource assembly must be stored in the global assembly cache.
Use the property to get the class name of the assembly.
For more information, see Policy Resource Overview.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ClassName As String
public: property System::String ^ ClassName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the class within the policy resource assembly that implements the interface that the associated policy feature uses to communicate with the policy resource.
Docs.value: A string that represents the name of the class.

remarks.para: Use the property to get the policy feature assembly name.

Because Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 does not call the policy resource directly, the resource is not required to implement a specific interface. However, the associated policy feature must recognize whatever interfaces the policy resource is implementing. The resource assembly must have a strong name and reside in the global assembly cache.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DefaultCustomData As String
public: property System::String ^ DefaultCustomData { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets any custom data passed to the policy resource.
Docs.value: A string that represents the custom data.

remarks.para: Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 does not parse this data, but merely passes it along to the policy resource.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Description As String
public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the description of the policy resource, and the service that it provides.
Docs.value: A string that represents the description of the policy resource.

remarks.para: This description is displayed in the Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 interface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FeatureId As String
public: property System::String ^ FeatureId { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the fully qualified name of the policy feature to which this policy resource belongs.
Docs.value: A string that represents the name of the policy feature.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property GlobalConfigPage As String
public: property System::String ^ GlobalConfigPage { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the URL to a Web control that is used to customize this policy resource at the server farm level.
Docs.value: A string that represents the URL of the Web control.

remarks.para: This Web control is hosted within Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 on the policy resource administration page, and enables the server farm administrator to set server farm-level settings for this resource. This URL must be server-relative.

If you do not specify a global custom settings control, administrators do not have the ability to overwrite or edit the default global data specified for the policy resource in the property, and therefore lack the ability to customize the policy resource at the administrator level.
For more information, see Policy Resource Overview.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ GlobalCustomData { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets the default settings for any server farm-level settings for this policy resource.
Docs.value: A string that represents the default settings.

remarks.para: This element can contain any valid XML that can be parsed by the custom settings controls specified by the property. Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 does not parse or use this data.
For more information, see Policy Resource Overview.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Id As String
public: property System::String ^ Id { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the fully qualified name of the policy resource.
Docs.value: A string that represents the fully qualified name of the policy resource.

remarks.para: Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 uses this name to uniquely identify each policy resource.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Name As String
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the policy resource name displayed in the interface.
Docs.value: A string that represents the policy resource name.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Publisher As String
public: property System::String ^ Publisher { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the policy resource creator, as it is displayed in the Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 interface.
Docs.value: A string that represents the name of the policy resource creator.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Type As String
public: property System::String ^ Type { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the resource type of this policy resource.
Docs.value: A string that represents the resource type of this policy resource.

remarks.para: You can use resource types to categorize resources for a specified policy feature.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Update() cil managed

Docs.summary: Writes the changes made to the policy resource back to the SharePoint content database.

remarks.para: If you do not call this method, any changes you have made programmatically to the policy resource are not saved.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Validate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Validates the policy resource assembly by loading the assembly.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void ValidateManifest(string xmlManifest) cil managed
Public Shared Sub ValidateManifest (xmlManifest As String)

Docs.param: The XML information policy resource definition to validate.
Docs.summary: Validates the specified XML information policy resource definition.

remarks.para: For more information about the schema to which policy resource definitions must adhere, see Policy Resource Definition Schema.
